Summary: This bill would mandate that the Department of Environmental Protection publish the results of their noise inspections online within 24 hours after they have been completed.

\pard\ltrpar\noline\sl480\slmult1\ul Be it enacted by the Council as follows:\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\ulnone Section 1. Section 24-207 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by local law number 53 for the year 2018, is amended to read as follows:\par
(f) The commissioner shall publish on the city's website\ul :\par
(i) \ulnone the manner by which noise levels shall be measured during inspections conducted pursuant to this section and in accordance with section 24-217.1 which shall be available online[.]\ul  and\par
(ii) the results of each inspection, which shall be available online within 24 hours after such inspection has been completed.\par
\ulnone [(f)]\ul (g)\ulnone  By no later than January 31 of each year, the department shall submit to the mayor and the council, and publicly post on its website, a report, containing, at a minimum, for the previous calendar year:\par
(i) the number of inspectors employed by the department;\par
(ii) the number of complaints regarding noise received by the department, disaggregated by the type of noise;\par
(iii) the number of after hours noise complaints responded to within the amount of time prescribed by rule as well as the number of duplicative after hours noise complaints;\par
(iv) the number of non-violation resolutions to complaints;\par
(v) the number of noise related violations issued;\par
(vi) the number of such violations which were dismissed;\par
(vii) the amount of civil penalties which were paid pursuant to such violations;\par
(viii) the number of alternative noise mitigation plans approved pursuant to section 24-221 of this code; and\par
(ix) the number of written stop work orders issued pursuant to section 24-223.1 of this code.\par
\'a7 2. This local law takes effect immediately.\par
